fields.description:
Tempo has a recursive velocity macro problem producing lots of error messages in the logs.
{code}
ERROR admin 1063x1459x1 usx21i 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/Tempo.jspa [velocity] VM #printSection: error : too few arguments to macro. Wanted 1 got 0
{code}
This seems to be a bug in Velocity but already solved in Velocity 1.5 since March 2007.
JIRA still comes with Velocity 1.4. Is there a good reason why Velocity has not been updated yet in JIRA?

Decription of the bug and samples to reproduce can be found here:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VELOCITY-108
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VELOCITY-71

Regards
fields.summary: Recursive Velocity Macro Problem

fields.description:
Upon opening saved filters in the Issue Navigator which search criteria is based on Select List custom field and is configured to use the Multi Select Search search template, the following WARN messages will be thrown in the logs file:
{noformat}
2012-01-19 10:06:59,882 http-8085-4 WARN admin 606x129x1 1u5tcwn 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/IssueNavigator.jspa [velocity] Could not determine type of iterator in #foreach loop  at [0,0] in template templates/plugins/fields/view-searcher/view-searcher-multioption.vm
{noformat}

Steps to reproduce:
- Create a Select List custom field, with a several options configured to it. Configure the CF to use the Multi Select Searcher search template
- Create several issues with having the Select List CF populated with values
- Perform search in the Issue Navigator, using the Select List CF as the search criteria
- Save the search results, and the WARN message will be thrown. Opening the filter again will also produce the same WARN message

Tested in JIRA 4.2.4 and 4.3.4, the problem doesn't exists in the version. This bug may seem to be a regression of JRA-7484
fields.summary: Opening filters having Select List CF that is using Multi Select Searcher search template will produce WARN messages in the logs

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-26849].
  {panel}

Basically, I'd like to be able to create a field for which one attribute of the field definition itself would be a template of a URL which would be executed in a new window by appending (or otherwise including) the contents of the field.

In other systems, such as RT, this type of feature is shown by a link icon next to the field (so that you can still edit the field in edit mode). If you click the link icon, it opens the URL in a new window.

The minimum requirement would be to be able to append the contents of the field to a URL. For example, if we were referencing a JIRA URL, we'd use:
https://support.atlassian.com/browse/
as the base URL (defined with the field), and then the field contents would be JST-30260 (for this ticket), which would result in:
https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-30260
when clicked.

Optionally, a more flexible scheme would allow the substitution of the field for a character or sequence of characters in the URL in the field definition, but that's unnecessary for our applications.
fields.summary: Create a Custom Field type that is populated based on the value of something else

fields.description:
Hello Team,

we upgraded to JIRA 4.4.3 and encountered an issue: During the https transfer we suddenly got warning, that JIRA will display some information obtained by unsecure transfer.
This happens in the IE7+8 (should be supported by JIRA 4.4.x).
Steps to reproduce:

    Log in
    In the menu bar expand the submenu Projects
    Select All projects
    Here we receive the warning message.
There are many more occurences, suh as filtering in Issue Navigator etc.

We found out that this is probably caused by calling res://ieframe.dll/navcancl.htm (see screenshot from the Temporary Internet Files related to that https call).
The navcancl.htm contains links to some icons, which are not delivered by https - and this causes the whole issue. See attached the navcancl.htm file.

Is there any way how to prevent this - anything else than upgrade to newer version of IE or using different browser? (Security policy).

This is very annoying...

Thank you,
Zdenek
fields.summary: Unexpected non-secure transfer in https protocol (IE7 + IE8)
Allowing ordering by project category in filter/issue navigator

fields.description: Steps to reproduce: # Take a custom field of type Select List (com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:select). # Add an option to it that is invalid if parsed as XML. Example: {code} Normal {code} # Set this option as a value of this custom field to some issue. # Open XML view. Observe: XML fails to be parsed, because the generated XML does not escape the option into CDATA section. XML looks like {code} [cf]Priority Normal {code} Expected: custom field value is wrapped into CDATA. Note that "Multi Select" and "Multi Checkboxes" custom fields wrap their values into CDATA. Reproducible on JIRA 5.0rc1.
fields.summary: "Select List" custom field values are not escaped in CDATA in issue XML view, leading to invalid XML

fields.description:
Nested enabled LDAP can be integrated with JIRA without a problem. If however due to poor search filter, lone child groups are imported, performance will greatly degrade. Upon reading the dump file, you will notice entries like:

{noformat}
"Thread-547" daemon prio=10 tid=0x00002aaabc6c8000 nid=0x2cfc runnable [0x0000000060d12000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
	at java.net.SocketInputStream.socketRead0(Native Method)
	at java.net.SocketInputStream.read(SocketInputStream.java:129)
	at java.io.BufferedInputStream.fill(BufferedInputStream.java:218)
	at java.io.BufferedInputStream.read1(BufferedInputStream.java:258)
	at java.io.BufferedInputStream.read(BufferedInputStream.java:317)
	- locked <0x00000006e4abab98> (a java.io.BufferedInputStream)
	at com.sun.jndi.ldap.Connection.run(Connection.java:820)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:662)

{noformat}

{noformat}
"http-80-64" daemon prio=10 tid=0x00002aaac4f5f800 nid=0x136c runnable [0x0000000048210000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
	at java.lang.Throwable.fillInStackTrace(Native Method)
	- locked <0x00000007ffcd19f8> (a com.atlassian.crowd.exception.GroupNotFoundException)
	at java.lang.Throwable. (Throwable.java:218)
	at java.lang.Exception. (Exception.java:59)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.exception.CrowdException. (CrowdException.java:17)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.exception.ObjectNotFoundException. (ObjectNotFoundException.java:39)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.exception.GroupNotFoundException. (GroupNotFoundException.java:17)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.exception.GroupNotFoundException. (GroupNotFoundException.java:12)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.ofbiz.OfBizGroupDao.findByName(OfBizGroupDao.java:98)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.ofbiz.OfBizDelegatingMembershipDao.result(OfBizDelegatingMembershipDao.java:179)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.ofbiz.OfBizDelegatingMembershipDao.search(OfBizDelegatingMembershipDao.java:108)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.AbstractInternalDirectory.searchGroupRelationships(AbstractInternalDirectory.java:749)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteDirectory.searchGroupRelationships(DbCachingRemoteDirectory.java:575)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.manager.directory.DirectoryManagerGeneric.searchDirectGroupRelationships(DirectoryManagerGeneric.java:864)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.manager.directory.DirectoryManagerGeneric.isUserNestedGroupMember(DirectoryManagerGeneric.java:897)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.manager.directory.DirectoryManagerGeneric.isUserNestedGroupMember(DirectoryManagerGeneric.java:872)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.manager.application.ApplicationServiceGeneric.isUserNestedGroupMember(ApplicationServiceGeneric.java:1414)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.core.CrowdServiceImpl.isUserMemberOfGroup(CrowdServiceImpl.java:261)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.core.CrowdServiceImpl.isUserMemberOfGroup(CrowdServiceImpl.java:266)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.core.DelegatingCrowdService.isUserMemberOfGroup(DelegatingCrowdService.java:70)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.core.FilteredCrowdServiceImpl.isUserMemberOfGroup(FilteredCrowdServiceImpl.java:194)
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.type.GroupDropdown.hasPermission(GroupDropdown.java:105)
	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.DefaultPermissionSchemeManager.hasSchemePermission(DefaultPermissionSchemeManager.java:415)
	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.DefaultPermissionSchemeManager.hasPermission(DefaultPermissionSchemeManager.java:380)
	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.DefaultPermissionSchemeManager.hasSchemeAuthority(DefaultPermissionSchemeManager.java:323)
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor588.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
{noformat}

This is due to the fact that Nested groups are expensive to calculate permissions for and this causes a lot of performance bottleneck. The thread dump above shows nested group memberships where the group does not exist, if this is common it will have a big impact on performance. This should not occur, but it seems possible if the LDAP configuration has changed and or these child groups have been removed.

*Workaround*

# Use the below SQL query to determine lone child groups and have them deleted.
{noformat}
select * from cwd_membership where membership_type = 'GROUP_GROUP' and child_name not in (select group_name from cwd_group);
{noformat}
# Remove the rows returned above.
# Restart JIRA and re-synchronize your directory.
# Confirm that the above query returns no result

This will definately have a great improvement in JIRA
fields.summary: JIRA is extremely slow when Nested group is enabled in LDAP and lone child-groups are imported due to improper search filter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-26816].
  {panel}

I enjoy a lot the new possibilities coming in JQL for doing requests on history, mainly driven through new keyword CHANGED and its operators (TO, FROM, BY, BETWEEN, etc).

However, for benefiting to its full potential from these new possibilities, it's important to retrieve in query result columns related to the query done on history.

For instance, one can now ask what were the issues planned for a version during last week. But if we want to sort the result by name of the people who did the planification, we can't, because we have no column available with the name of the people who did the change.

Another example, one can now ask what were the issues planned by 'Smith' during last week. But if we want to sort the result by value of new FixVersion, or by value of old FixVersion, we can't, because we have no column available with the value of the field changed during the change (old value and new value).

Either I'm missing something, or these new, computed, columns are missing for exploiting queries on history to their full power.
fields.summary: It's great having CHANGED keyword in JQL. Next step is having columns 'changer/old value/new value' available in filters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-26815].
  {panel}

If you invoke IssueService.validateTransition() and IssueService.transition() inside of a post-function or an event listener (which is triggered by a post-function):

* the history log is correct
* the activity log is correct
* the available transitions on the issue screen are correct
* BUT the status of the issue is NOT correct

So the issue is left in a confusing state where the status tells the user one thing, but the available transitions to perform tell the user something else.

For additional details, please see the internal support issue https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-105568, where Atlassian has confirmed that "Indeed it is not possible to fire off a transition to a new status from within a post function using the issueService".
fields.summary: IssueService.validateTransition() and transition() are unusable inside of post-functions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-26806].
  {panel}

In the usual GUI, if an issue is moved between project, JIRA is capable of redirecting the user from the old URL to the new one with a HTTP code 302. 

This feature would be extremely useful in the REST API as well if we're trying to get an issue using only the issue KEY (no search). 

Use case:
 - a user create an issue AAA-123
 - Java app (API) using a search extract that issue to disk (or perform some work on the issue) and store the issue key (AAA-123) on disk.
 - User move issue from project AAA to project BBB, resulting in BBB-234
 - the REST API querying issue AAA-123 no longer find the issue (HTTP code 404 in REST)...

Expected result:
 - the REST API allows the request to succeed, giving you BBB-234. The key field in the JSON will be BBB-234.
 - -the REST API should return a code 302 with the self URL of the moved issue to the new location.- (JIRA will not 302 in this case)


BTW, I was hoping to workaround the problem with a JQL query like:
{noformat}
"issuekey" was "AAA-123"
{noformat}

but the "was" keyword doesn't seem to be present in JIRA 4.4.3.

That issue is also present in the SOAP API, although I'm sure fixing only REST would be sufficient as we're all moving that API anyway ;)
fields.summary: Allow REST callers to access moved issue via their old issue KEY

fields.description:
This issue is discussed in this thread:
http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257246364

However, the bug I'm reporting is because it seems that when an issue is deleted, then the pcounter value should be adjusted.  In particular, when all issues for a project are deleted, then the pcounter value should be reset to 0.

I don't see any value in keeping the pcounter for that project at the same number where it was before the issues were deleted.
fields.summary: Deleting an issue for a project should change the pcounter value

fields.description:
Reproduction: Set up Confluence and JIRA with differing userbases and an OAuth Trusted Apps link. Add the Confluence QuickNav gadget to JIRA's Dashboard and type the name of a page in Confluence.

Should produce a dropdown of suggestions, but does not. When sharing the same users (for instance, "admin" on both servers), the dropdown works over OAuth & Trusted Apps as expected.
fields.summary: Confluence QuickNav gadget does not produce javascript dropdown with differing users
JIRA Documentation update - clarify that Bamboo can now use JIRA's userbase.
Detection of duplicate issues at "Create Issue" stage
Develop mobile app
Add calculated summary row to issue navigator

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 19-Dec-2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hello everyone!

Since this bug report was originally raised a while ago, and for a version of Jira that is no longer supported, we performed tests to validate the scenario and found that in Jira 7.3.9 (currently the minimum version supported) as well as in the latest Jira 7.13 the current behavior provided is that the decimal separator applied will be the one corresponding to the language that the user has set in the user profile while the digit group separator (or thousands separator) will be ignored. For example, if you change the user profile to Deutsch ([^profile-language.PNG]), the decimal separator will be "," (comma) and the dot will be the digit group separator which is simply ignored; logging work for "1,5h" (one, comma, five) will result in _1 hour, 30 minutes_ and if the same user changes his language to English or Spanish( both use dot as decimal separator), the same "1,5h" will result in _15 hours_ (see example: [^logged work.PNG]). The limitation of this behavior is that the decimal separator is tied to the language.

Now that the current expected behavior is explained, this is considered obsolete as a bug and will be closed. We do see the value on preventing the invalid decimal separator from being used and have raised the Feature request JRASERVER-68600 Prevent using group separator/invalid decimal separator when entering numeric values where we will be gathering the interest in changing the current behavior.

In case you have additional scenarios where this behavior is inconsistent, please raise a support request for our support team to analyze and determine the next steps.
 * You can raise a support request from [https://support.atlassian.com/contact/]

Best regards,
 René Chiquete - JAC Champion.
{panel}
In JIRA 4.2.2 When user enters '3,5h' he will run into error "Invalid time duration entered" as shown below :

!error.png!

Currently in JIRA 4.4 when user accidentally enter 3,5h Time spent will be logged as shown below :

!timespent.png!

When I changed into German as the default language it showed the correct format when entering 3,5h :

!timespent1.png!

When I changed into English as default language and enter '3.5h' it showed the correct time :

!timespent2.png!

The current issue: 
 JIRA shouldn't accept 3,5h when the user is using English settings and show error as before in JIRA 4.2.2
fields.summary: Time Spent should not accept comma when user in English settings

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-26775].
  {panel}

The LocalGadgetSpecFactory hangs onto a cache of CacheableGadgetSpec objects, which is updated when a plugin's modified date is after the date at which we put it into the cache.

As these objects are loaded via the plugin's class loader (as far as we are aware), this will block the destruction of the plugin's class loader on plugin uninstall.

This may potentially lead to ClassCastExceptions in the future.

One could first verify that this is an issue by using YourKit to take a memory dump after uninstalling a plugin, and determining if the plugin's class loader is still in memory.
fields.summary: LocalGadgetSpecFactory may potentially block destruction of gadget plugin class loader

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-26773].
  {panel}

There are two wording improvements that constitute this issue:
# When creating a remote link to an issue on another JIRA server, if you don't have permission to access the issue on the remote JIRA server, the following message is displayed:
\\ \\
#* {{Failed to create reciprocal link from XYZ-123. The remote JIRA instance returned the following error: No Link Issue Permission for issue 'XYZ-123'.}}
\\ \\
However, this feels a little cumbersome and is potentially cryptic. Hence, could we please change this to:
\\ \\
#* {{-A reciprocal link from issue 'XYZ-123' back to this issue was not created as you do not have the 'Link Issue' project permission for 'XYZ-123' on the remote JIRA server.-}} This text was not possible as the error message is given by the remote JIRA server.
\\ \\
#* {{A reciprocal link from issue 'XYZ-123' back to this issue was not created as the remote JIRA server returned the following error: No Link Issue Permission for issue 'XYZ-123'.}}
\\ \\
# When creating a remote link to a Confluence page, if the Confluence site's remote API feature has not been enabled (which is highly likely considering that this feature is disabled by default in Confluence), the following message is displayed:
\\ \\
#* {{Could not access Confluence Remote API. Please check that it is enabled.}}
\\ \\
However, this message's brevity makes it fairly cryptic and it doesn't really explain the cause of the problem --- which the user would find frustrating. Hence, could we change this to:
\\ \\
#* {{Content on the Confluence site could not be accessed because the Confluence server's 'Remote API' feature is disabled. The Confluence system administrator must enable this 'Remote API' feature for JIRA to successfully access this content.}}
fields.summary: Wording improvements for Remote Issue Link-related error messages in JIRA 5.0.

fields.description:
It is not possible to install a Plugin directly via the UPM, if the URL does not contain a filename with the extension '.jar'.

Steps to reproduce:

* open the UPM in JIRA 4.4
* select 'install' and search for 'time.ON'
* click 'Install Now'

Error in UI: 'Could not find a handler capable of installing the plugin at https://plugins.atlassian.com/server/1.0/download/pluginVersion/771865. Check that the file is a valid plugin.'

Error in catalina.out: '2012-01-10 16:41:53,205 pool-7-thread-1 ERROR admin 981x200x1 zj8xha 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1%0 /rest/plugins/1.0/ [com.atlassian.upm.PluginInstaller] File 'https://plugins.atlassian.com/server/1.0/download/pluginVersion/771865' is not a valid plugin: Cannot install plugin with unsupported file extension: plugin.7054045458908279751.servlet.FileDownload'

-------

The URL

https://plugins.atlassian.com/server/1.0/download/pluginVersion/771865

gets redirected to 

https://oncommerce.secure.force.com/servlet/servlet.FileDownload?file=00P30000009nZjm

HTTP-Headers:

HTTP/1.0 200 OK
Content-Length: 254870
Server: 
Cache-Control: s-maxage[1]
Last-Modified: Tue, 22 Nov 2011 13:49:41 +0000
Content-Disposition: inline; filename="timeon-1.4.1.jar"
Content-Type: application/java-archive
Date: Tue, 10 Jan 2012 15:57:39 GMT
Connection: close

------------

The filename and correct content type is submitted via HTTP. The UPM ignores both and tries to determine the file type by the URL, which is clearly a wrong behavior.

------------

I'm setting the priority to Major, because i suspect, that there are more plugins in the plugin exchange affected by this bug.
fields.summary: UPM: Plugin installation fails due to missing file extension

fields.description:
# Create a issue with a zero estimate.
# Log work on the issue. 
# (BUG) Goto the issue navigator and look at the issue. Make sure the work ratio column is configured. Note the very large percentage.

*Cause:*
*workratio* = Logged Time * 100 / Original Estimate
When "Original Estimate" is 0 (and not undefined) the division returns max_int_64 = 9223372036854775807

*Workaround:*
For issues that already have an estimate set, change original estimate to 1m 
Don't set original estimates to 0. The default value is "not defined" but can't be set back to that
fields.summary: Logging work on a issue with a zero estimate will result in a work ratio of 9223372036854775807%

fields.description:
*Original Description*:
I get an error message when releasing version because of a dialog expecting a wrong format.

* I have a "Day/Month/Year Format" of "yyyy-MM-dd"
* I have a version with a release date "2011-12-31"
* I click on "Release" in the "Manage Versions" window
* I get the confirmation window asking me to release with the "Release Date" filled out to my previously selected Release date in the proper format e.g. "2011-12-31"
* I click on "Release" again
* I get the error message "Please enter the date in the following format: d/MMM/yy"

The release dialog clearly doesn't respect my chosen Day/Month/Year Format settings but requires d/MMM/yy instead. This can be either seen as a bug or as an inconvenience.

I checked by setting my Year/Month/Day format to "d/MMM/yy" and everything works as expected. The release date field is prefilled in the correct format so the Release button works without an additional error message.

{color:red}*Update:*{color}
{panel}
I have found a workaround which worked for a customer who had a very similar issue. Please try this in your JIRA instance:

# Navigate to JIRA Administration > System > User Interface > Look and Feel.
# Leave the *Day/Month/Year* Format blank.
# Save.
# Try releasing a version.
{panel}
fields.summary: "Release Version" dialog doesn't respect Day/Month/Year format

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-26730].
  {panel}

Login into JIRA OnDemand instance which has:
1. Time Tracking - activated
2. Tempo plugin enabled.

----------------------------------------

This behaviour is only on IE9

1. View an issue.
2. Press 't' to launch Tempo's 'Log Work' dialog.
3. Enter the values in the specific fields.
4. Move focus to either 'Add' or 'Add and close' and press the 'Enter' key on the keyboard to submit the values.

This results in !jiraserver_error.png!.

Work gets logged perfectly well, IF, we use Mouse to click on 'Add' button.

Closely monitoring the network logs shows that when key press is used to submit the form, network request such as this '/secure//rest/tempo-rest/1.0/worklogs/PRJAMLKV-212' is made. This fetches a 404 response from the server. !network.png!

This issue does not appear on Chrome or Firefox.


Video capture: http://screencast.com/t/u75PRD26v
fields.summary: On IE9, Tempo's Log Work dialog fails when 'Add/Add and Close' button is pressed using the Enter key
Inserting timestamps in due dates in emails instead of "bare date"

fields.description:
When an issue summary contains unexpected characters, the generated notification e-mails to not adequately guard against them, leading to corrupted e-mails.  We suspect the problem was originally caused using the REST/SOAP APIs, but I was able to reproduce it using an altered import file where I embedded XML entities for CR LF CR LF into the issue's summary attribute.  As a result, the CR LF CR LF sequence appears literally in the Subject: header, leading to premature termination of the headers and a corrupted e-mail.  For example:

{noformat}
Date: Mon, 9 Jan 2012 09:06:04 +1100 (EST)
From: "admin admin (JIRA)" <admin@example.com>
To: shared@example.com
Message-ID: <1307186241.1.1326060364482.JavaMail.user@mail.example.com>
Subject: [TestJIRA] admin admin shared "TESTPROJ-1: Test Issue #1

" with
 you
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
Precedence: bulk
Auto-Submitted: auto-generated
X-JIRA-FingerPrint: 01b36f2d94c53c7211fd1055284fb06b

[...]
{noformat}
fields.summary: Unexpected issue data leads to corrupted e-mails
